channel.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
channel.description:
Is there any quick ways to do it?
And I'm talking about the Rscd Database with no forums included.
But yeah is there any quick ways of transferring the database or am I going to have to do it the long way?

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

ownagesbot:

entries for every character, if someone has 5 chars they’re going to end up with 5 forum accounts, not to mention you won’t have all the info for the forum entries (such as DOB/email etc). This kid needs to start from scratch.

Not always the case. With Invision Power Board, you can set up external login authentication for on-fail logins. Upon first login, it will ask for an email address and a display name but once finished, IPB registers it locally as a forum user.

Read full topic

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

[quote author=Anc13nts253 link=topic=421177.msg3093186#msg3093186 date=1263066304]Is there any quick ways to do it?

The quickest way would be to write a converter, a script that loops through the entries in the Demonik database and converts them into entries for the RSCD database. I’ve never used Demonik so I don’t know how much they differ but anything is possible, it’s just down to how much time it takes.

Post the Demonik database structure with one entry in each table so I can see how it differs from RSCD and I’ll answer your question.

Although, if I’m honest, I really wouldn’t bother. Your server has been up what, 2-3 days? I’d just start fresh as it will take you a lot longer to convert than it will for your players to train again.[/quote]err… not that simple, KO9 is right, the database is dependant upon the forum, therefore you would also have to create new forum entries for every character, if someone has 5 chars they’re going to end up with 5 forum accounts, not to mention you won’t have all the info for the forum entries (such as DOB/email etc). This kid needs to start from scratch.

Read full topic

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

The other problem is registration, the “name” column is generated as a series of numbers based on the number in the “owner” column and the “username” column. The server reads the “name” column when players log in and it acts as a primary key for all other tables, such as experience, curstats, bank, friends, ignores, invitems, ect. What is nice about RSCD_v4 is that it ignores the “name” column and instead reads the plaintext “username” column and uses that to connect the dots.

Read full topic

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote author=Nemesis- link=topic=421177.msg3095660#msg3095660 date=1263271870]owner is actually the forum user id.

I’m quite aware, but my point is everything thinks they have to use PunBB when really any forum software could be used. The only thing you would need to change is the JOIN query where it checks PunBB’s bans table to confirm that their forum account isn’t banned. If it wasn’t for converting all the posts and topics I would be using phpBB in all honesty.[/quote]

phpBB? The most exploited forum software to date? I’d rather use SMF or vBulletin.

Read full topic

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

The owner column in rscd_players is just a random ID, you can change it to a random number, it would take a tiny modification to allow any forum system to work with RSCD to be honest.

owner is actually the forum user id.

Read full topic

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

In my case, the converters that I worked to create went from RSCD_v25 to Demonik.

I’ll be a little more specific: RSCD_v4, also known as LEFTYS_RSCD_NOFORUMS (what Reines later released on Reinet, which is a more updated version of RSCD_v25) uses an almost identical database structure as Demonik. My converter scripts took RSCD_v25 and converted all the players into RSCD_v4 players. In doing so, it made each player an individual account and gave the “shared” bank under each forum “owner” to only one of the players under each owner.

You really don’t want to go in the opposite direction, the amount of work to do it is not worth the time. If you like RSCD_v25, then by all means, go the RSCD_v4 route instead. You won’t even need PunBB! (IPB forum allows external authentication if you really wanted to…)

http://3hit.net/smf/index.php?topic=531.0 <- RSCD_v25 Database Converter that I posted on 3hit.net

http://www.4shared.com/file/99751475/8e56ceb4/RSCD_Noforums.html <- RSCD_NOFORUMS download (RSCD_v4)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 11, 2010, 04:52:37 pm[/size][hr][quote=“KO9, post:3, topic:324819”]The RSCD database is dependant on the forum database.[/quote]

Not in RSCD_v25, each player is tied to each forum account through the “owner” collumn. This is how all players created under the same owner can share the same bank account in game.

Read full topic

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

[quote=“Anc13nts253, post:15, topic:324819”][quote author=Nemesis- link=topic=421177.msg3094966#msg3094966 date=1263189317]
so you didn’t fix shit after all.you can make demonik stable as rscd v25 easily, if you know how to program it. obviously you don’t
[/quote]
I’m not I don’t know how to program it. I am saying I don’t want to use up time of mine fixing it fully to be as good as Rscd which will take time. Pretty much everything is fixed, I just know a few dupes that are easily fixed within my demonik. So don’t try and even compete against me. Gf.[/quote]
Piece of cake. Remember ,Decompiler is botters friend =), 2 ways to prevent players logging from diff clients:
Change login method(edit it loads), but still they can decompile, and add it to their bot.
Check package, Botters can easily change the package to same as yours.
Might be more ,but these came up in my mind while writing this post.

Read full topic

item.title: [Transfer] Demonik To Rscd Database
item.dc:creator: @N_Y_T_R_I_X N Y T R I X
item.description:
@N_Y_T_R_I_X wrote:

[quote=“Anc13nts253, post:13, topic:324819”][quote author=Kryptix link=topic=421177.msg3094716#msg3094716 date=1263172847]
Why are you switching to RSCD?
[/quote]

Because It is a little bit more stable then Demonik, nothings going to be lost from my source when I transfer over everything is going to be the same.
Demonik is based off the Rscd V2 or V3 source I think?
So why not transfer it to the v25?
Also, I already know a majority of all the bugs & dupes on Rscd and I already know how to make it so no one can login with any other client except mine.
& I am making the pking\dueling like demonik because I think that its better then Rscd.
Also +1 for you using the source I released as a base for RscEmulation lol.[/quote]

I thought you said you knew how to fix all the bugs and dupes on demonik as well?
And also for the “I already know how to make it so no one can login with any other client except mine”…l0l good luck with that one…you wont get far

Read full topic
